conclusion: To find the electric field strength, analyze the forces acting on the small ball and set them equal to each other.
The image shows a small ball of mass m and charge q suspended by an insulating string of length L, making an angle Î¸ with the vertical direction.
The ball is at rest in a uniform horizontal electric field.
The forces acting on the ball include tension (T), Coulomb force (qE), and gravity (mg).
The ball is at rest, so the net force acting on it must be zero.
The tension in the string is balanced by the Coulomb force (qE) and the gravitational force (mg).
Apply Newton's second law: F = ma.
The tension (T) in the string is equal to the gravitational force (mg) plus the Coulomb force (qE).
